title: Inquiry-Based Genetics Understanding: An Integrated Approach to Molecular, Genetic, and Meiosis Models

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: University students explore three genetic models (inheritance, meiosis, molecular) to scientifically analyze everyday genetic issues (GMOs, genetic testing, etc.), aiming for integrated understanding. Designed per literature-based instructional design principles

learning_goals: Students can explain genetic inheritance patterns through case analyses based on Mendelian genetic models.
Students can simulate meiosis processes using 3D modeling tools and explain genetic distribution mechanisms.
Students can analyze the gene expression process at the molecular level and experimentally demonstrate the genotype-phenotype relationship.
Students can apply genetic concepts to provide scientific evidence for socially contested cases (e.g., GMOs).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
